author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Charlamagne Tha God urged Senate Democrats to reopen the government, citing citizens’ dire needs amid the federal shuttering.  The radio host said during a Wednesday segment of “The Breakfast Club” that the party needs to abandon the fight to extend Affordable Care Act (ACA) premium subsidies to ensure that federal workers receive pay.  “Dems, you…
title: Charlamagne Tha God presses Dems to end shutdown impasse: ‘Stop playing politics’

author: Steve Israel, opinion contributor
description: Democrats must embrace both progressive and centrist candidates in order to win the 2026 midterm elections, and must focus on local issues in order to win over voters.
title: Mamdani’s victory shows how Democrats can win the midterms

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Political commentator Bill O’Reilly suggested Friday that Tuesday’s blue election sweep can be tracked to voters’ issues with affordability and a rising cost of living just 10 months into President Trump’s second term, saying, “People are angry.” Responding to “Real Time” host Bill Maher’s suggestion that Americans are looking for more “normal” leaders, O’Reilly said…
title: O’Reilly on Democrat’s 2025 election sweep: ‘People were angry’

author: Jillian Snider, opinion contributor
description: Crime rates have decreased in most cities since the pandemic, but the average age of offenders and victims has increased, indicating a shift in the age-crime curve and the need for public-safety strategies to reflect this change.
title: America’s crime problem hasn’t grown, but it has aged

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao on Friday denied having any business ties with President Trump or his sons, adding that he did not expect to be pardoned last month. “I believe my lawyers submitted the petition in April,” Zhao told Fox News’s Bret Baier on “Special Report,” referring to the clemency as a “surprise.” “It…
title: Pardoned Binance founder says alleged connections to Trump sons ‘don’t exist’

author: Michelle You, opinion contributor
description: Unstable policy is driving capital away from climate infrastructure just when we need more of it.
title: Carbon removal’s biggest barrier is finance, not science

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Students are taking a more careful approach to their higher education amid the questionable economy and new policies by the Trump administration cracking down on student loan relief.  More Americans are earning double majors due to fears one degree won’t be enough to make it in the job market and fears that their student loans…
title: From shifting loans to double majors, the economy is changing how students approach college

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former Sen. Jeff Flake (R-Ariz.) suggested Friday that a Republican migration away from President Trump is underway as a result of Trump not understanding voters or their needs. “The president may not want to talk about the affordability crisis, but he’s going to have to,” Flake said in an interview with CNN host Erin Burnett.…
title: Jeff Flake says Trump is ‘completely out of touch’ with Americans

author: Ryan Mancini
description: An airline industry analyst on Friday suggested the effects of flight capacity reductions across the country are generally small, despite an uptick of delays and cancellations as the government shutdown drags on. “The airlines are doing their level best to minimize inconvenience and to avoid canceling too many flights at any one time in order…
title: Airline analyst: ‘I’m not hearing of chaos’

author: Jim Nussle, opinion contributor
description: The CDFI Fund works — it turns small amounts of federal dollars into truly impactful investments in communities.
title: A Treasury fund ignites community development — don’t just abolish it

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: President Trump on Saturday took a swipe at Democrats and health insurance companies as lawmakers struggle to find consensus on a bill to reopen the government. Trump, weighing in on the debate around high health care premiums as Affordable Care Act (ACA) tax credits are poised to expire soon, suggested that funds be diverted from…
title: Trump rips Democrats, ‘BIG, BAD’ health insurance companies amid shutdown stalemate

author: Ryan Mancini
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James (D) on Friday filed a motion to dismiss the federal fraud charges brought against her by the Trump administration, arguing the case was based on President Trump‘s political animus. “The government targeted AG James for prosecution because of the President’s genuine animus towards her protected campaign speech and fulfillment…
title: Letitia James accuses Trump of ‘vindictive’ political animus in motion to dismiss fraud charges

author: Jianli Yang, opinion contributor
description: Supporting the L-1 visa system in this way does not contradict Trump’s “America First” agenda — it fulfills it.
title: Skilled labor L-1 visas are critical to the US manufacturing revival

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson temporarily halted an order requiring the Trump administration make full Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP) November payments by Friday.  Jackson’s order pauses some of the payments until the U.S. Court of Appeals for the First Circuit can decide the administration’s motion to block the order pending its appeal.  It…
title: Ketanji Brown Jackson halts order requiring full SNAP payments, for now
